alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Jackson; Mellette; Todd (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:03PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN TODD...SOUTHWESTERN MELLETTE...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON AND NORTHEASTERN BENNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM MDT/945 PM CDT/... At 802 PM MDT/902 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southwest of Norris, or 26 miles west of White River, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Todd, southwestern Mellette, southeastern Jackson and northeastern Bennett Counties, including the following locations... northwestern Rosebud Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT/1000 PM CDT/ for southwestern South Dakota.
